comment: Professor rating: it was really interesting to observe his editing to our podcasts. super fast when clicking and dragging thru things, so I would try and remember , or ask, what he did so I could do it later on.

There's two tests and some discussion posts. My only gripe was that the textbook seems to be his and is really expensive. Some of the test questions are worded a little funny, but just reread and go with your gut. If you watch the lectures and read the chapters you'll do fine. He's very nice and responds to emails quickly. I enjoyed the class
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: he can tell if you need something before you do, it helped me so muc. I needed an adapter and he gave me one ,said "keep it "
This man knows me and has helped me every step of the way. This place been crazy and he actually sees me.
I forgot to take an exam and he will work with you!
McNeil helped me apply for a scholarship and gain more confidence on the air. When you get graded, he gives specific things to fix.

This class was a complete waste of my time. I took the course to learn more about audio editing but the professor barely taught anything. The entire semester is 4 grades so there is no room for error or mistake. Professor McNeill is like the absent father of professors and makes no attempt to connect with students.

I joined this class after dropping another due to disagreements with the teacher. this instructor professional and made me more confident with recording booth. he cares and will also work with you and help you edit your work and record.

He is a great professor, unlike others I've had this semester. I thoroughly enjoyed coming to class and I learned a lot. Everything we had to do, whether it was assignments or just showing up and listening, was very valuable. He cuts right to the chase and distilled this class into a very enjoyable, valuable, productive, and memorable experience.
He has actually been in movies and helped me. Very strict and opinionated but it made me  better in end

Only three grades (two tests and a project). He wrote the textbook, it was 35 pages and cost 70 dollars. One chapter was a single page. Lectures were short and low quality. He did not respond to my emails asking for help or clarification. Content on the exams was nowhere the in lectures or textbook. He had to heavily curve both tests.

The Capstone was fairly easy, even with the short summer semester. One paper and a poster - each section is graded alone, then there is a grade for the overall project. Some groups had 3-4 people, ours had just two. Although it was nice getting a 100, some feedback along the way would have been nice, too. Very quick to answer his emails.

A good prof. If you go to class and do the work, he's more than willing to help out. A little tough at times, as well as picky, but I have enjoyed having him as a prof for the two classes I've had him in so far!

Do not take this class online with this professor. No work assigned first four weeks of class outside of reading the textbook he made (which is the hardest to read textbook I've ever dealt with). I've never struggled so badly in an online course so I suggest you look elsewhere. Two tests + group project with occasional discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor McNeill was an okay guy. There are only 7 grades total in the class, 4 discussions, a paper, the midterm and final. He takes forever to grade things so you never know how you are doing in the class. Very minimal work.

Beneficial Capstone course. As with any Capstone, there is a lot of work involved, but Dr. McNeill divides up work evenly throughout the semester and is quick to respond to any questions that arise. Very clear about course objectives. Highly recommend him.

if i could rate this man a 0/5 i absolutely would. we had a midterm, a final, a project, and were randomly given 3 discussions which were all over his own writings that he clearly wanted feedback on. his video lectures did absolutely nothing- i guessed on both tests and somehow passed both. he did NOTHING. if he is your last option as a prof- DONT.

He didn't email the class once the entire semester. All he does is post lecture videos of him going over the chapters. Also, he wrote the book. We only had a midterm, a final, and a project. Then he added in random discussion posts just so he could get feedback on his research that he's done. To me, he didn't want to teach this class at all.

I took Professor McNeill over the summer for capstone and I'm so glad I did! He's super nice and will always answer any questions you have. Since it was a summer session, he does divide you into groups for the capstone, so be ready for that. As a bonus, he's super helpful and guides you every step of the way. I wish I could take him again.

Dr. McNeil is an amazing professor. Each class is a lecture, but he makes them very interesting with real-world examples. The only grades in the course are 3 exams, but are all pretty easy. We don't use the textbook at all. Overall, he is an amazing professor, highly recommend.

Although attendance isn't required, its the only way to get the material for the online tests. None of it comes from the book. I was sick and missed a day and learned he doesn't post anything online either.

This class isn't at all hard, but I can't say I really learned anything. We had two tests and two projects. He's good for answering emails in a timely matter. Just remember to keep up with the modules if you take it online.

By far the best professor Ive had. I had him for Film video structure & processes. We didnt use the book at all. As long as you go to class and pay attention to his lectures (which isnt hard because he keeps them interesting), its the easiest class you can take. This has been the only class so far that I actually looked forward to.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Took the topics of entertainment class( podcasting) in the summer (hybrid)and I loved it. He's very helpful and Caring. know Adobe audition before you get in class. The final Is online but is open book, but know your stuff before your reach the final.
Dr. McNeil knows what he is talking about and has been in the communication industry. He doesn't accept projects late and is very accessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Make sure you keep at it. If you slack every week the work will pile up especially when that week involves project deadlines. His class consisted of weekly discussion post which weren't that bad, sometimes boring though, 2 tests, and 2 projects. If you look at the module at least 2-3 times a week and do some work you'll be fine.

LOVE HIM!!! He is so funny and is very clear on what he expects.  Non-traditional and working students BEWARE... 90% of assignments are on location and not during class time.  So if you have outside obligations this class will definitely be challenging and can be a bit stressful. It's all group work so cross your fingers for good group members.

I took this class online and it wasn't too bad.  He requires weekly discussion posts, 2 exams, and 2 projects.  As long as you do well on the projects (not too hard), you'll do fine in the class.  It is easy, however, to slack in online classes...I wouldn't recommend doing that with this class.

Dr. McNeil is so passionate about the class and helps as much as he can. He's very intelligent and sometime has a hard time explaining things on the 'avg student' level. The book we used is one he wrote and he just rereads the bk in class. It wasn't always easy to grasp the material but overall the class is great just do all the work w/effort.

Professor McNeill is a great professor! Move your schedule around to take him! He is always willing to help and responds quickly. He won't stand for laziness or rudeness and those are the only people who don't like him. He has valuable knowledge and gives great advice. The work is also easy if you take the time to turn in quality work. Best teacher
nice class, good times
TERRIBLE TEACHER!!!! he does not explain anything and when you try to ask questions he will either mock you or not answer your question.

He's awesome. I tried to rearrange my schedule to take him again. Wonderful, engaging lecturer, with tons of real-world experience and great, memorable examples to draw from.  This class was almost complete lecture and I was never, ever bored. A great teacher.

The only bad thing I have to say is that he can be tempermental. Other than that, he's very nice, interesting to listen to, a good speaker and funny. Wants you to do well on the tests, gives you links to practice tests and puts .ppts online. Class isn't hard - only 4 tests, no "final." Good prof! Hope to take him again.
